results.title: Eight in the 80's
results.brief_description: Showcases eight interesting and innovative films made on the low budget medium of Super 8. Because of the gauge’s low cost and extreme flexibility the filmmakers using Super 8 have a freedom that allows them to create genuinely exciting and rich works, ranging from diaristic experimental films to straighter narrative dramas through to absurdist, surrealistic comedies.

results.title: On your marks it's bright sparks. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Jeff Gale, Mark Lamprell and Pru Donovan
results.brief_description: Planes, Trains, Boats and Cars: Sparky, Amy and Alex discover floating bikes, underwater boats, trucks without drivers, trains without trucks, cars that become boats and planes that become helicopters. But can Alex really turn his BMX bike into an excavator to drill a hole to China? “Water, Water, Everywhere”: Planet Earth should be called Planet Water says Sparky, as he flies Amy and Alex around the world to see why. From the Amazon River to the River Nile and even Antarctica, Amy and Alex see how water is a wonderful gift - to be used, enjoyed and shared by everyone.

results.title: Musical Tales
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Elizabeth Bennett and John Hosier
results.brief_description: This beautifully animated puppet film presents four of your favourite stories set to the great classical music of Tschaikovsky, Stravinsky and Delibes. Featurees “The Nutcracker and the Mouse King”, “Petrushka”, “Coppelia” and “Sleeping Beauty”.

results.title: Lady and the Tramp
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Lady, a pampered cocker spaniel, and Tramp, a jaunty mutt with a heart of gold, join an equally delightful cast of characters for an animated masterpiece. It’s an enthralling story, breathtaking animation and memorable songs, (written and performed by the legendary Peggy Lee) provide unparalleled romance, adventure and enchantment. Rated: G

results.title: Tiga
results.brief_description: An animated film by Lucinda Clutterbuck with an original musical score by Paul Schutze. “Tiga” is dedicated to Benjamin, the last Tasmanian Tiger in captivity.

results.title: David to the Rescue
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Micheline Charest and Ronald A Weinberg
results.brief_description: David is always ready to help his fellow creatures out of trouble - but that usually leads him into adventure. “David to the Rescue” - David goes to Italy to attend a sick Gnome child. Finding the healing flower is a challenge which only he can handle. “The Baby Troll” - A baby Troll is stuck on a rock in the middle of the river. David must call upon a friend to help save him.

results.title: Don't eat the pictures
results.brief_description: This zany musical follows the adventures of Big Bird, Smiffy, Cookie Monster and the rest of the Sesame Street gang as they find themselves accidentally locked in the Metro Museum overnight. Featuring cameo appearances by James Mason, Fritz Weaver and Paul Dooley.

results.title: Cry freedom
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Marble Arch Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The unforgettable friendship of two unforgettable men. The tension and the terror of South Africa is powerfully portrayed in director Richard Attenborough’s sweeping story of black activist Stephen Biko (Denzel Washington) and liberal white newspaper editor Donald Woods (Kevin Kline) who risks his life to bring Biko’s story to the world. In this explosive, emotional and thrilling film, Woods slowly learns the true horrors of apartheid through Biko’s eyes. When the South African authorities begin to view Biko as a major threat to their government, he is arrested and silenced by the police. Determined not to let Biko’s message go unheard, Woods, himself now under house arrest, undertakes a perilous quest to escape South Africa. This riveting true adventure offers a stirring account of man at his most evil and most heroic.

results.title: The Silent one
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, David Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: A deaf mute boy, Jonasi, the Silent One, arrives as a baby floating in from the sea to an isolated, paradisical Pacific village. He is adopted and raised by a childless woman. As a pubescent boy he is separated from the villagers and the coming-of-age rituals by his silence and their prejudices. In his isolation he seeks solace in the sea, with which he has always had a special, gifted bond. He developes a special relationship with a huge white turtle. Times are bad: the superstitious villagers blame both Jonasi and the turtle who are seen as evil spirits. A struggle for leadership sweeps Jonasi to his strange destiny. Starring Telo Malese (Jonasi), Pat Evison, Anzac Wallace, Rongo Tupatea Kahu. Spectacular underwater photography by Ron and Valerie Taylor. Based on the novel by Joy Gowley.

results.title: Watership down
results.brief_description:
One dim moonlit night, a small band of rabbits leave the comfort and safety of their warren and set out on a long and dangerous journey after a premonition of a terrible disaster that will overtake them if they stay. None of them knows where they are heading, or the dangers they will face in their search for a new warren where they can live in peace. Adapted from Richard Adams’ modern classic.
Voiced by actors including: John Hurt, Richard Briers, Ralph Richardson, Denholm Elliott, Zero Mostel, Nigel Hawthorne, Michael Hordern, Joss Ackland.
